text:
<vsshistory vsspath="${SrcSafePath}" ssdir="${SSCommandPath}" 
fromLabel="${labeltogetfrom}" output="${afile}"/>

The maximum label length in VSS is 31 chars, the above task will fail if 
${labeltogetfrom} has a length of more than 30 chars.

creator: aaron.raisey@equinox.co.nz
text:
<vsshistory vsspath="${SrcSafePath}" ssdir="${SSCommandPath}"
			fromLabel="${labeltogetfrom}" output="${afile}"/>

If ${labeltogetfrom} > 30 chars long ${afile} is created, so the task appears 
to work, but ${afile} is empty so the task has obviously not completed 
successfully.  VSSHISTORY needs to perform against labels of 31 chars - VSS's 
max label length.

creator: jesse@cryptocard.com
text:
VSS will accept a label of up to 31 characters for 'Label' operations.

For 'History' operations using only 1 label, up to 31 characters are accepted.

For 'History' operations using 2 labels, the first label is truncated to 30
characters, the second accepts 31.

To make sure that VSS files labeled with the <vsslabel> task can have their
history retreived with the <vsshistory> task I've imposed a 30 character limit
on all operations that use labels.

A warning is logged if a label must be truncated.

I've modifed all the clases that use the label attribute and added another test.

This patch is against HEAD which has many changes not in the 1.5 branch, I can
make a patch for 1.5 if needed.

Jesse
